column4: How do I change my Ubuntu login name? I seem to be able to change the real name, but not the account name.
that requires editing some files in a way that you could mess up real bad :P
easier just to create a new user and move over your files :)
great. :S I just wish I'd known things like IRC would start using my username in my whois.
is it difficult to copy over the files from one account into another?
create new user, make yourself root, rm -rf /home/newuser; cp -r /home/olduser /home/newuser; chown -R newuser:newuser /home/newuser
that copies the files; you can also use mv, but that may mess up your old user
I was reading something about chown. that works?
your new user must own the files in his homedir :P
yes, but once you've copied them and changed owner on the copied files, you can remove the old user and his files.
make sure you make your new user an admin too though :)
otherwise you'll lose access to sudo if you delete the old user
any user who is able to use sudo is "admin"
